recommendations.rationale: This branch is already dedicated to Phase 2 work and still active. Task 8 (Phase 1 deployment) is deployment/documentation work that doesn't conflict with tooltip feature development.

safetyChecks: Clean Working Tree: Must have no uncommitted changes before starting waves (research doc committed in pre-execution)
Remote Sync: Pull latest changes from remote to avoid divergence during parallel execution
Backup Branch: Create timestamped backup branch before starting - allows recovery if parallel execution creates issues
Port Availability: Verify deployment ports (3000, 5173, 8080, 8765) are available before testing subtasks
Build Success: Run build before final merge to ensure no compilation errors introduced
Wave Validation: After each wave commit, verify git log shows expected commit and working tree is clean
preExecutionCommands: git commit -m 'docs: add parallel execution skill git enhancement research...'

taskInfo.title: Phase 1: Deploy to Replit & Ship MVP

potentialIssues.issue: Merge conflicts when merging back to main
potentialIssues.mitigation: Pull latest main before starting (pre-execution). If conflicts occur during final merge, the per-wave commits provide clear boundaries for resolving conflicts.

potentialIssues.issue: Deployment testing (8.2) fails and blocks wave completion
potentialIssues.mitigation: Per-wave commits mean we can commit Wave 1 with 8.2 marked as failed, fix issues, then continue with Wave 2. Backup branch allows full rollback if needed.
Wave-based execution ensures only one wave commits at a time. Agents within a wave should work on isolated files.

potentialIssues.issue: Lost work if terminal disconnects during execution
potentialIssues.mitigation: Backup branch preserves pre-execution state. Per-wave commits mean partial progress is saved. Use tmux for terminal persistence.
